idea-plugin.name: Unlogged
idea-plugin.description:
Version 1.16.28 (2nd Aug 2023)

We are excited to announce the latest release of Unlogged, version 1.16.28! This release brings significant improvements and new features that empower developers to easily monitor and verify their code changes, ensuring a seamless development experience and preventing regressions. Let's take a look at the key highlights of this release:

Assertions for Custom Validation:

Unlogged now introduces the power of assertions with a brand-new intuitive user interface (UI). With this feature, developers can define custom assertions to validate method return values, all the way down to the key level, without writing any code manually. Say goodbye to spending hours crafting assertion rules; now, you can create complex and nested validation rules with ease through our UI.

Enhanced Method Comparison:

In previous versions, Unlogged only compared the return values of changed methods, which sometimes led to false failures when dealing with ever-changing values like timestamps or external API responses. Now, with the addition of assertions, developers can perform comprehensive validation on method behavior. Each code change triggers Unlogged to replay the code execution, applying the defined custom assertions to ensure accurate and reliable results.

Zero Extra Code:

Unlogged has always focused on minimizing developer effort. With this release, we take that philosophy a step further. Defining and maintaining the assertions need no extra code, enabling you to focus solely on delivering quality code.

Instant Regression Testing:

Thanks to Unlogged's automated recording of method input and return values, developers can instantly replay code changes and verify the behavior of their applications with custom assertions. This feature accelerates the development process and provides early feedback, allowing for quick identification and resolution of potential issues before they escalate.

Enhanced Developer Productivity:

Unlogged's latest release is designed to enhance developer productivity significantly. By minimizing manual testing efforts, providing detailed validation through custom assertions, and offering instant regression testing, developers can focus more on innovation and delivering high-quality code.

How to Get Started:

  • Install Unlogged from JetBrains marketplace
  • Add the dependency in your pom.xml or build.gradle,
  • Add @Unlogged above your main method.
  • Run your project in debug mode, call your methods directly, and replay previously saved inputs.
  • Click on Change Assertions. (Remember, the default assertion is comparison of return values, as is)
  • Define the assertions as you like, and Save!

Bug Fixes and Improvements

In addition to the exciting new features, this release includes various bug fixes and performance improvements. Unlogged is now more stable and efficient than ever, providing a seamless experience for developers.

We hope that this latest release of Unlogged brings immense value to your Java development. As always, we are open to feedback and suggestions to make Unlogged even better. Feel free to reach out to our support team on Discord with any questions or comments.

Join Unlogged at Discord

Version 1.16.3 (5th Jul 2023)

Exciting New Features Unleashed in Unlogged!

We are thrilled to unveil the latest enhancements in Unlogged that will elevate your development experience to new heights. Get ready to embark on a joyous coding journey with these amazing updates.

Simplified Project Setup

Setting up your project has never been smoother! Integrate Unlogged effortlessly by adding the pom.xml dependency. With just a few clicks, you'll be up and running in no time.

Test Creation Made Easy

Creating tests for your methods is now a breeze. Once your project is running, head to the method you wish to test. No need to stress - simply click on the lively Guttor Icon and select "Direct Invoke." It's as simple as that!

Direct Invocation Magic

Say goodbye to the hassle of exposing HTTP endpoints. Thanks to Unlogged's Direct Invoke feature, you can now call any Java method directly. Experience the freedom of invoking methods without unnecessary complexities.

Execute with Relevance

Supercharge your testing process by providing relevant inputs to your methods. Execute the method effortlessly with the desired inputs, and witness the magic of Unlogged at work. Get instant results and revel in the joy of efficient testing.

Relive the Magic with Atomic Tests

Record and replay your methods with ease using Atomic Tests. Say goodbye to repetitive input scenarios - save your input/return value combinations as convenient JSON files. Replaying recorded inputs has never been more delightful!

Unveiling Key Terms:

Direct Invoke: Unleash the power of direct method invocation with Unlogged. No more relying on HTTP endpoints - call any Java method directly and unlock a world of convenience and speed.

Atomic Tests: Elevate your testing game with Atomic Tests. Record and save input/return value combinations effortlessly as JSON files. Replay these tests seamlessly and save valuable time.

Let's Decode the Gutter Icon States:

  • Red Icon: This friendly icon indicates that your application is not running with the Unlogged SDK. No worries! Just add the required dependency in your pom.xml, and you're on your way to an enhanced development experience.

  • Cyan Icon: Congratulations! Your application is rocking the Unlogged SDK. Enjoy the perks of Direct Invoke by navigating to any method you desire.

  • Pink Icon: Exciting times ahead! This icon signals the availability of input/return value recordings for a method. Dive into the joy of reusing and replaying these inputs effortlessly.

  • Bolt Icon: Experience lightning-fast changes! Modify your methods with confidence, knowing that Unlogged will hot reload the changes and replay the recorded inputs. Enjoy a seamless development cycle like never before.

  • Green Tick: Upon replaying, this delightful icon assures you that there have been no changes in return values for the recorded inputs. Celebrate the consistency!

  • Different Tick: A friendly heads-up! This icon indicates that one or more return values don't match for the recorded inputs upon replaying. Pay attention to these variations and tweak your code accordingly.

Gradle: Please note that we are diligently working on Gradle compatibility, and Gradle support will be available in our upcoming release. Stay tuned for even more exciting updates!

Unlogged is here to revolutionise your development process and bring joy to your coding adventures. Embrace these new features and experience the delight of seamless development. Happy coding!
